thread.title: The Unloved Retail Sector Is Quietly Attempting a Rebound

author: Akane Otani
title: The Unloved Retail Sector Is Quietly Attempting a Rebound
text:
After one of their toughest years ever, beleaguered U.S. retailers are enjoying a pickup in quarterly sales, helping to boost the shares of many brick-and-mortar operators even as the stock market stumbles this year.
The moves mark a partial respite for retailers, which have reckoned with sliding sales, record store closures and bankruptcy filings as consumers have increasingly shifted to shopping online.
